MS MCQs

    Introduction to mixed reality

    »

    1. What is mixed reality?

      A set of virtual-reality hardware devices sold by Microsoft

      A spectrum of immersive experiences, connecting and blending physical and digital worlds together

      An augmented-reality platform application that comes with Microsoft HoloLens


    2. What is the difference between virtual-reality and augmented-reality experiences?

      Virtual reality fully immerses a user in a digital environment, whereas augmented reality keeps users in their physical environment.

      Augmented reality fully immerses a user in a digital environment, whereas virtual reality keeps users in their physical environment.

      Virtual-reality content is available only on holographic devices, whereas augmented-reality content can run only on immersive equipment.


    3. How would you describe a hologram?

      Immersive 3D objects made of opaque pixels

      Physical objects that react to digital content

      Digital objects made of light and sound


    4. What tool would a design team use to prototype mixed-reality digital interactions, objects, and UI by using crafting materials?

      Storyboarding

      Whiteboarding

      Bodystorming


    5. Mixed reality exists at the crossroads of which of the following?

      Humans, computers, and environments

      Hardware, software, and industry

      Manufacturing, education, and training
